u.a: mɑ kʌp ə tıi ın dɛə [*]
voiced dental fricative replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
labio-dental approximant inserted before vowel in "tea"; first element of cluster omitted in "leaves";
voiced dental fricative replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
voiceless alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless labio-dental fricative; second element of cluster omitted;
voiced dental fricative replaced by voiced labio-dental fricative;
voiceless palato-alveolar affricate replaced by voiceless alveolar plosive;

g.ga: I want to get down now

u.a: voiceless palato-alveolar fricative replaced by dentalised alveolar fricative;
first syllable omitted; velar nasal replaced by bilabial nasal;
second element of cluster omitted in both words;
alveolar lateral approximant omitted; alveolar nasal replaced by bilabial nasal; alveolar fricative becomes voiced;
referring to Teddy going to bed
commentary while throwing crusts to the birds
referring to small pieces of bread
means to say 'Daddy isn't allowed any more'
pointed to single carrot but plural form used
command to put shoes in water to clean them
voiced palato-alveolar affricate replaced by voiced alveolar plosive plus alveolar lateral approximant;
request to leave skin on the apple
voiceless alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless labio-dental fricative; second element of cluster omitted; consonant harmony at beginning of second syllable;
voiceless alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless bilabial plosive; second element of cluster omitted;
voiceless alveolar fricative replaced by voiceless labio-dental fricative; second element of cluster omitted;

CHAT.comment: 1.At this stage , tag questions are not understood , and Lucy tends to repeat the tag , e.g. 'I'll put some on a plate , shall I?' elicited "Shall I?" in response. 2."lellow" (from yellow) still being used for "another".
